sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's Wednesday, the 18th of May. Good morning, Europe. A very warm welcome to the program.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Let's begin by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The future of Ukrainian fighters from the Azovstal steel plant now in Russian custody is uncertain as Moscow says they could be tried and even executed instead of exchanged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Calls mount to unblock Ukraine's black seaports as Russia's invasion causes increased global inflation and grain shortages, with experts warning of a cascade of export bans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And the Cannes Film Festival is well and truly underway after years of pandemic-related interruptions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We take a look at what's in the lineup.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They're called heroes by Ukraine and Nazi criminals by Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: What happens now to the hundreds of Ukrainian fighters who surrendered on Tuesday, ending weeks of resistance at the Azovstal steelworks in Mariupol, is unclear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After handing themselves over, they were transferred to Russian-controlled territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After handing themselves over, they were transferred to Russian-controlled territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's deputy defense minister said they would be swapped in a prisoner exchange, but some Russian officials have said they could be tried and even executed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is a political statement conceived as internal propaganda with an eye to internal political processes in the Russian Federation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: From our side, we can say that the negotiation process is ongoing and that the rescue operation itself is ongoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the Russian parliament or Duma, there seems to be strong support for refusing to include any of the Azovstal fighters in a prisoner swap, a sentiment seemingly supported by the Speaker.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Nazi criminals should not be exchanged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They are war criminals, and we must do everything to bring them to justice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia's top prosecutor has reportedly asked the country's Supreme Court to designate the Azov Regiment, whose members held out in the Mariupol steel plant, as a terrorist organization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Azov Regiment was formed in 2014 as a volunteer militia to fight Russia-backed forces in East Ukraine, and many original members had far-right extremist views.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Since then, the unit was integrated into the Ukrainian National Guard and its commanders say it's moved away from its far-right origins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Calls for an urgent solution to unblocking Ukraine's black seaports are growing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Exports from the country, which produces as much as half the world's sunflower seeds and a tenth of wheat, have been severely interrupted by the closure of Ukraine's ports following Russia's invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's driving up inflation and shortages around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Commission has already announced a solidarity lane strategy to unblock borders with Ukraine and boost capacity on road and rail routes to export Ukrainian grain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Germany is now making its railways capable of transporting large quantities of agricultural products from Ukraine to safe harbors in the north and Adriatic seas. Now we are facing a new challenge which is more economical, trying to help food from Ukraine and Moldova to reach its destined global markets because we want to prevent any shortage in other parts of the world for the fact that these countries cannot deliver.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And this is an immense logistic challenge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But experts are also warning of a cascade of export bans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It follows India's snap decision to stop selling its wheat and Indonesia's move to block its palm oil exports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Fears of food insecurity are causing governments to put feeding their own people before others, adding to soaring food prices the big news in Brussels is Finland and Sweden finally

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: officially applying for NATO membership the chief EU diplomat Jose Borrell said that this is good news for the security in Europe however without the support of all NATO members Sweden and Finland cannot join the military alliance. And Turkey's president has restated his opposition to both countries joining NATO just hours after they said they would seek membership, accusing them of harbouring terror groups, including Kurdish militants. For some analysts, Ankara is using Sweden and Finland's membership bid as leverage to fix the most pressing issues it has with the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At the same time, Brexit issue is back in town, with tensions quite high between Brussels and the UK, following the UK's announcement that it will draft a new post-Brexit trade protocol with Northern Ireland in the coming weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: draft a new post-Brexit trade protocol with Northern Ireland in the coming weeks. The EU clearly said it would need to respond with all measures at its disposal in case the UK decides to move ahead unilaterally with that bill, disapplying substantial elements of the protocol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On the other hand, it said that it understands the practical difficulties emerging from the implementation of the protocol and stands ready to further discuss options to facilitate the flow of goods and benefit people and businesses of Northern Ireland, but only in the context of the protocol, which is, as they say, an integral part of the withdrawal agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And despite the fact that some EU sources I spoke to told me there is far too early to detail what an exact response would be a breach of the protocol would certainly risk retaliation and potentially kick-start a trade war. Efi Koutsakosta for Euronews Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The battle for Kherson is the focus of Ukraine's war efforts in the south of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We were allowed close to the front lines of a fight waged village by village, which destroys everything in its path.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This road used to lead to Crimea, territory Ukraine lost in 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now residents say they are staying behind to protect what is left of their homes and of their country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: What can I tell you? Stone by stone, we built these houses with our own hands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: To leave this is very hard for us. Very hard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We don't want this war. We want to be in peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Sorry, I don't know what else to say.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The tension is overwhelming.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Everyone here is on edge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We have to keep moving and fast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Shelling is constant and, according to troops, indiscriminate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Soldiers show us a local school bombed earlier in the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They use what kind of ammunition right now?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Cluster bombs, artillery, mine-and-match tanks, rifles, all of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And they shouldn't run them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They haven't a special target, you know.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's like a drum.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Cluster ammunition is banned under international treaty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Further down the road, we meet residents gathering to receive their only means of survival these days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Yes, we give them aid often. We were here yesterday on the 4th of May, on the 16th, to help all families. Yes. Pasta, sandwiches, we will show you right now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For these people's lifeline, Andrei is risking his.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ah, this?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Yes, yes, yes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After bullets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: When? Last week when we were evacuating people from here. As people continue to queue, artillery fire gets close once again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Very close, very, very, very close.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Yes, yes, go, go, go, go, go, go. We have to move.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Leaving behind those who say staying is their choice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We are confident and stubborn people, and we are waiting for them to be kicked out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This is my house. I don't want to give it to them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: waiting for them to be kicked out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is my house. I don't want to give it to them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Lyubna and husband Leonid have been spending every night in their dark dump basement, alongside piles of jars with pickled vegetables.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Wet here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It can get cold, they say, but it's safe. And above all, it's home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Annalise Borges in Chevchenkovy in southern Ukraine for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Every night they go here to stay here and sleep.
